info.title: Rclone RC API
info.description: Full OpenAPI specification for the Rclone RC API.

post.description: Returns all supplied parameters unchanged so you can verify RC connectivity.
Permanently removes trashed objects from the specified remote path.
Copies one object from a source remote and path to a destination remote and path.
Downloads a public URL and stores it at the requested remote path.
Deletes matching files and directories for the provided remote, honouring filters and config overrides.
Removes a specific object from the remote.
Returns backend features, hash support, metadata descriptions, and other info for the remote.
Produces a hash sum listing for files under the given path using the requested hash algorithm.
Returns the hash of a single file using the specified hash algorithm.
Moves one object from a source remote and path to a destination remote and path.
Creates a share URL for an object or removes an existing link when `unlink=true`.
Deletes empty subdirectories beneath the specified path, optionally leaving the root.
Updates the storage class or tier for every object in the specified remote path.
Updates the storage class or tier for a single object.
Reports total size, file count, and number of objects without size metadata.
Reads the current bandwidth limit or applies a new schedule string, just like `rclone rc core/bwlimit`.
Executes a standard rclone CLI command remotely and streams or returns its output.
Returns disk usage statistics for the supplied local directory (defaults to the cache dir).
Triggers Go's garbage collector to release unused memory.
Lists stats groups currently tracked by rclone.
Returns Go runtime memory statistics similar to `runtime.ReadMemStats`.

200.description: Memory statistics fields from the Go runtime.

post.description: Obscures a plain-text secret for inclusion in `rclone.conf`.
Returns the process ID of the running rclone instance.
Stops the rclone process, optionally supplying an exit code.
Deletes the counters associated with a specific stats group.
Clears counters, errors, and finished transfers for the provided stats group or all groups.
Returns up to 100 recently completed transfers for the requested stats group.
Same as `rc/noop`, but requires authentication to validate access control.
Always returns an error response incorporating the supplied parameters, useful for testing error handling.
Returns metadata about every available RC command, including whether authentication is required.
Invokes a backend-specific management command against an optional remote.
Drops cached directory entries, and optionally cached file data, for the cache backend.
Ensures specified file chunks are cached locally for a cache remote.
Returns runtime statistics for the cache backend.
Creates a new remote in `rclone.conf`, mirroring `rclone config create`.
Removes an existing remote from `rclone.conf`.
Returns the contents of the config file as a JSON object keyed by remote name.
Returns the key/value settings for a single remote.
Returns the names of all remotes defined in the config file.
Sets obscured password fields for a remote configuration.
Returns the paths to the config file, cache directory, and temporary directory.
Returns metadata describing each supported storage provider.
Points rclone at a specific `rclone.conf` file.
Unlocks the configuration file using the provided password.
Updates an existing remote with new parameter values.
Returns the running rclone version, build metadata, and Go runtime details.
Returns active transfer statistics including bytes transferred, speed, and error counts.
Run a batch of rclone rc commands concurrently.
Returns identifiers of active and recently completed asynchronous jobs.
Returns timing, success state, output, and progress for a specific job.
Attempts to cancel a running job by ID.
Cancels all active jobs associated with the provided stats group.
Lists objects and directories for a remote path, returning the same fields as `rclone lsjson`.
Returns metadata for a single file or directory, mirroring `rclone lsjson` on one entry.
Returns storage quota and usage details for the remote, equivalent to `rclone about`.
Accepts multipart/form-data payloads and writes the uploaded files to the specified remote path.

requestBody.description: Multipart form payload containing one or more files to upload.

post.description: Deletes a directory or container and all of its contents.
Creates the target directory or container if it does not exist.
Deletes an empty directory or container.
Compares source and destination trees, reporting matches, differences, and missing files.
Synchronises a source remote to a destination remote, making the destination match the source.
Copies objects from a source remote to a destination remote without deleting destination files.
Moves objects from a source remote to a destination remote, optionally cleaning up empty directories.
Performs a bidirectional synchronisation between two paths, supporting safety checks and recovery options.
Returns the names of option blocks that can be queried or updated.
Returns the current global option values, optionally filtered by block.
Returns metadata for options, including help text and defaults, grouped by block.

Sets temporary option overrides for the running process by supplying key/value pairs grouped under option block names. Provide one or more query parameters whose names match the blocks you want to modify (for example `main`, `rc`, `http`). Each block parameter carries an object of option overrides.
Returns the current effective options for this request, including `_config` and `_filter` overrides.
Returns all running `rclone serve` instances with their IDs and options.
Launches a new `rclone serve` endpoint (http, webdav, ftp, etc.) with the provided parameters.
Stops a running `serve` instance identified by its ID.
Stops every active `serve` instance.
Returns the list of supported `rclone serve` protocols.
Evicts specific files or directories from the VFS directory cache.
Lists the active VFS instances and their identifiers.
Reads or updates the VFS poll interval duration, optionally waiting for the change to apply.
Returns the contents of the VFS upload queue.
Sets the expiry time of a queued VFS upload item, optionally relative to its current value.
Refreshes one or more directories in the VFS cache, optionally recursively.
Returns VFS statistics including disk cache usage and metadata cache counters.
Downloads and installs a plugin into the WebUI from the provided repository URL.
Returns plugins matching the requested MIME type and optional plugin type.
Returns metadata for installed production and test plugins.
Returns metadata for installed test plugins.
Uninstalls a plugin from the WebUI.
Uninstalls a test plugin from the WebUI.

GlobalAsyncParam.name: _async
GlobalAsyncParam.description: Run the command asynchronously. Returns a job id immediately.

GlobalConfigParam.name: _config
GlobalConfigParam.description: JSON encoded config overrides applied for this call only.

GlobalFilterParam.name: _filter
GlobalFilterParam.description: JSON encoded filter overrides applied for this call only.

GlobalGroupParam.name: _group
GlobalGroupParam.description: Assign the request to a custom stats group.

Job_BatchPostConcurrencyParam.name: concurrency
Job_BatchPostConcurrencyParam.description: Do this many commands concurrently. Defaults to --transfers if not set.

Job_BatchPostInputsParam.name: inputs
Job_BatchPostInputsParam.description: List of inputs to the commands with an extra _path parameter.

Operations_CleanupPostFsParam.name: fs
Operations_CleanupPostFsParam.description: Remote name or path to clean up, for example `drive:`.

Operations_CopyfilePostSrcFsParam.name: srcFs
Operations_CopyfilePostSrcFsParam.description: Source remote name or path, such as `drive:` or `/` for the local filesystem.

Operations_CopyfilePostSrcRemoteParam.name: srcRemote
Operations_CopyfilePostSrcRemoteParam.description: Path to the source object within `srcFs`, for example `dir/file.txt`.

Operations_CopyfilePostDstFsParam.name: dstFs
Operations_CopyfilePostDstFsParam.description: Destination remote name or path, such as `drive2:` or `/` for local filesystem.

Operations_CopyfilePostDstRemoteParam.name: dstRemote
Operations_CopyfilePostDstRemoteParam.description: Target path within `dstFs` where the file should be written.

Operations_CopyurlPostFsParam.name: fs
Operations_CopyurlPostFsParam.description: Remote name or path that will receive the downloaded file, e.g. `drive:`.

Operations_CopyurlPostRemoteParam.name: remote
Operations_CopyurlPostRemoteParam.description: Destination path within `fs` where the fetched object will be stored.

Operations_CopyurlPostUrlParam.name: url
Operations_CopyurlPostUrlParam.description: Source URL to fetch the object from.

Operations_CopyurlPostAutoFilenameParam.name: autoFilename
Operations_CopyurlPostAutoFilenameParam.description: Set to true to derive the destination filename from the URL.

Operations_DeletePostFsParam.name: fs
Operations_DeletePostFsParam.description: Remote name or path whose contents should be removed.

Operations_DeletefilePostFsParam.name: fs
Operations_DeletefilePostFsParam.description: Remote name or path that contains the file to delete.

Operations_DeletefilePostRemoteParam.name: remote
Operations_DeletefilePostRemoteParam.description: Exact path to the file within `fs` that should be deleted.

Operations_FsinfoPostFsParam.name: fs
Operations_FsinfoPostFsParam.description: Remote name or path to inspect, e.g. `drive:`.

Operations_HashsumPostFsParam.name: fs
Operations_HashsumPostFsParam.description: Remote name or path to hash, such as `drive:` or `/`.

Operations_HashsumPostHashTypeParam.name: hashType
Operations_HashsumPostHashTypeParam.description: Hash algorithm to use, e.g. `md5`, `sha1`, or another supported name.

Operations_HashsumPostDownloadParam.name: download
Operations_HashsumPostDownloadParam.description: Set to true to force reading the data instead of using remote checksums.

Operations_HashsumPostBase64Param.name: base64
Operations_HashsumPostBase64Param.description: Set to true to emit hash values in base64 rather than hexadecimal.

Operations_HashsumfilePostFsParam.name: fs
Operations_HashsumfilePostFsParam.description: Remote name or path containing the file to hash.

Operations_HashsumfilePostRemoteParam.name: remote
Operations_HashsumfilePostRemoteParam.description: Path to the specific file within `fs` to hash.

Operations_HashsumfilePostHashTypeParam.name: hashType
Operations_HashsumfilePostHashTypeParam.description: Hash algorithm to use, e.g. `md5`, `sha1`, or another supported name.

Operations_HashsumfilePostDownloadParam.name: download
Operations_HashsumfilePostDownloadParam.description: Set to true to force reading the data instead of using remote checksums.

Operations_HashsumfilePostBase64Param.name: base64
Operations_HashsumfilePostBase64Param.description: Set to true to emit the hash value in base64 rather than hexadecimal.

Operations_MovefilePostSrcFsParam.name: srcFs
Operations_MovefilePostSrcFsParam.description: Source remote name or path containing the file to move.

Operations_MovefilePostSrcRemoteParam.name: srcRemote
Operations_MovefilePostSrcRemoteParam.description: Path to the source object within `srcFs`.

Operations_MovefilePostDstFsParam.name: dstFs
Operations_MovefilePostDstFsParam.description: Destination remote name or path where the file will be moved.

Operations_MovefilePostDstRemoteParam.name: dstRemote
Operations_MovefilePostDstRemoteParam.description: Destination path within `dstFs` for the moved object.

Operations_PubliclinkPostFsParam.name: fs
Operations_PubliclinkPostFsParam.description: Remote name or path hosting the object for which to manage a public link.

Operations_PubliclinkPostRemoteParam.name: remote
Operations_PubliclinkPostRemoteParam.description: Path within `fs` to the object for which to create or remove a public link.

Operations_PubliclinkPostUnlinkParam.name: unlink
Operations_PubliclinkPostUnlinkParam.description: Set to true to remove an existing public link instead of creating one.

Operations_PubliclinkPostExpireParam.name: expire
Operations_PubliclinkPostExpireParam.description: Optional expiration time for the public link, formatted as supported by the backend.

Operations_RmdirsPostFsParam.name: fs
Operations_RmdirsPostFsParam.description: Remote name or path to scan for empty directories.

Operations_RmdirsPostRemoteParam.name: remote
Operations_RmdirsPostRemoteParam.description: Path within `fs` whose empty subdirectories should be removed.

Operations_RmdirsPostLeaveRootParam.name: leaveRoot
Operations_RmdirsPostLeaveRootParam.description: Set to true to preserve the top-level directory even if empty.

Operations_SettierPostFsParam.name: fs
Operations_SettierPostFsParam.description: Remote name or path whose storage class tier should be changed.

Operations_SettierfilePostFsParam.name: fs
Operations_SettierfilePostFsParam.description: Remote name or path that contains the object whose tier should change.

Operations_SettierfilePostRemoteParam.name: remote
Operations_SettierfilePostRemoteParam.description: Path within `fs` to the object whose storage class tier should be updated.

Operations_SizePostFsParam.name: fs
Operations_SizePostFsParam.description: Remote name or path to measure aggregate size information for.

Core_BwlimitPostRateParam.name: rate
Core_BwlimitPostRateParam.description: Bandwidth limit to apply, for example `off`, `5M`, or a schedule string.

Core_CommandPostCommandParam.name: command
Core_CommandPostCommandParam.description: Name of the rclone command to execute, for example `ls` or `lsf`.

Core_CommandPostArgParam.name: arg
Core_CommandPostArgParam.description: Optional positional arguments for the command. Repeat to supply multiple values.

Core_CommandPostOptParam.name: opt
Core_CommandPostOptParam.description: Optional command options encoded as a JSON string.

Core_CommandPostReturnTypeParam.name: returnType
Core_CommandPostReturnTypeParam.description: Controls how output is returned; accepts `COMBINED_OUTPUT`, `STREAM`, `STREAM_ONLY_STDOUT`, or `STREAM_ONLY_STDERR`.

Core_DuPostDirParam.name: dir
Core_DuPostDirParam.description: Local directory path to report disk usage for. Defaults to the rclone cache directory when omitted.

Core_ObscurePostClearParam.name: clear
Core_ObscurePostClearParam.description: Plain-text string to obscure for storage in the config file.

Core_QuitPostExitCodeParam.name: exitCode
Core_QuitPostExitCodeParam.description: Optional exit code to use when terminating the rclone process.

Core_StatsPostGroupParam.name: group
Core_StatsPostGroupParam.description: Stats group identifier to return a snapshot for. Leave unset to include all groups.

Core_StatsPostShortParam.name: short
Core_StatsPostShortParam.description: When true, omit the `transferring` and `checking` arrays from the response.

Core_StatsResetPostGroupParam.name: group
Core_StatsResetPostGroupParam.description: Stats group identifier whose counters should be reset. Leave unset to reset all groups.

Core_TransferredPostGroupParam.name: group
Core_TransferredPostGroupParam.description: Stats group identifier to filter the completed transfer list. Leave unset for all groups.

Debug_SetBlockProfileRatePostRateParam.name: rate
Debug_SetBlockProfileRatePostRateParam.description: Sampling interval in nanoseconds for blocking profile collection; use 1 to capture all events.

Debug_SetGcPercentPostGcPercentParam.name: gc-percent
Debug_SetGcPercentPostGcPercentParam.description: Target percentage of newly allocated data to trigger garbage collection.

Debug_SetMutexProfileFractionPostRatePar.name: rate
Debug_SetMutexProfileFractionPostRatePar.description: Sampling fraction for mutex contention profiling; set to 0 to disable.

Debug_SetSoftMemoryLimitPostMemLimitPara.name: mem-limit
Debug_SetSoftMemoryLimitPostMemLimitPara.description: Soft memory limit for the Go runtime in bytes.

Mount_MountPostFsParam.name: fs
Mount_MountPostFsParam.description: Remote path to mount, such as `drive:` or `remote:subdir`.

Mount_MountPostMountPointParam.name: mountPoint
Mount_MountPostMountPointParam.description: Absolute local path where the remote should be mounted.

Mount_MountPostMountTypeParam.name: mountType
Mount_MountPostMountTypeParam.description: Optional mount implementation to use (`mount`, `cmount`, or `mount2`).

Mount_MountPostMountOptParam.name: mountOpt
Mount_MountPostMountOptParam.description: Mount options encoded as JSON, matching flags accepted by `rclone mount`.

Mount_MountPostVfsOptParam.name: vfsOpt
Mount_MountPostVfsOptParam.description: VFS options encoded as JSON, matching flags accepted by `rclone mount`.

Mount_UnmountPostMountPointParam.name: mountPoint
Mount_UnmountPostMountPointParam.description: Local mount point path to unmount.

Backend_CommandPostFsParam.name: fs
Backend_CommandPostFsParam.description: Remote name or path the backend command should target.

Backend_CommandPostArgParam.name: arg
Backend_CommandPostArgParam.description: Optional positional arguments for the backend command.

Backend_CommandPostOptParam.name: opt
Backend_CommandPostOptParam.description: Backend command options encoded as a JSON string.

Cache_ExpirePostRemoteParam.name: remote
Cache_ExpirePostRemoteParam.description: Remote path to expire from the cache, e.g. `remote:path/to/dir`.

Cache_ExpirePostWithDataParam.name: withData
Cache_ExpirePostWithDataParam.description: Set to true to drop cached chunk data along with directory entries.

Cache_FetchPostChunksParam.name: chunks
Cache_FetchPostChunksParam.description: Comma-separated chunk specifier list (e.g. `0:10,25:30`) describing file pieces to prefetch.

Config_CreatePostNameParam.name: name
Config_CreatePostNameParam.description: Name of the new remote configuration.

Config_CreatePostParametersParam.name: parameters
Config_CreatePostParametersParam.description: JSON object of configuration key/value pairs required for the remote.

Config_CreatePostTypeParam.name: type
Config_CreatePostTypeParam.description: Backend type identifier, such as `drive`, `s3`, or `dropbox`.

Config_CreatePostOptParam.name: opt
Config_CreatePostOptParam.description: Optional JSON object controlling interactive behaviour (e.g. `obscure`, `continue`).

Config_DeletePostNameParam.name: name
Config_DeletePostNameParam.description: Name of the remote configuration to delete.

Config_GetPostNameParam.name: name
Config_GetPostNameParam.description: Name of the remote configuration to fetch.

Config_PasswordPostNameParam.name: name
Config_PasswordPostNameParam.description: Name of the remote whose secrets should be updated.

Config_PasswordPostParametersParam.name: parameters
Config_PasswordPostParametersParam.description: JSON object of password answers, typically including `pass`.

Config_SetpathPostPathParam.name: path
Config_SetpathPostPathParam.description: Absolute path to the `rclone.conf` file that rclone should use.

Config_UnlockPostConfigPasswordParam.name: configPassword
Config_UnlockPostConfigPasswordParam.description: Password used to unlock an encrypted config file.

Config_UpdatePostNameParam.name: name
Config_UpdatePostNameParam.description: Name of the remote configuration to update.

Config_UpdatePostParametersParam.name: parameters
Config_UpdatePostParametersParam.description: JSON object of configuration key/value pairs to apply to the remote.

Config_UpdatePostOptParam.name: opt
Config_UpdatePostOptParam.description: Optional JSON object controlling update behaviour (e.g. `obscure`, `continue`).

Job_StatusPostJobidParam.name: jobid
Job_StatusPostJobidParam.description: Numeric identifier of the job to query, as returned from an async call.

Job_StopPostJobidParam.name: jobid
Job_StopPostJobidParam.description: Numeric identifier of the job to cancel.

Job_StopgroupPostGroupParam.name: group
Job_StopgroupPostGroupParam.description: Stats group name whose active jobs should be stopped.

Operations_ListPostFsParam.name: fs
Operations_ListPostFsParam.description: Remote name or path to list, for example `drive:`.

Operations_ListPostRemoteParam.name: remote
Operations_ListPostRemoteParam.description: Directory path within `fs` to list; leave empty to target the root.

Operations_ListPostOptParam.name: opt
Operations_ListPostOptParam.description: Optional JSON-encoded object of listing flags (e.g. `{ "recurse": true, "showHash": true }`).

Operations_ListPostRecurseParam.name: recurse
Operations_ListPostRecurseParam.description: Set to true to list directories recursively.

Operations_ListPostNoModTimeParam.name: noModTime
Operations_ListPostNoModTimeParam.description: Set to true to omit modification times for faster listings on some backends.

Operations_ListPostShowEncryptedParam.name: showEncrypted
Operations_ListPostShowEncryptedParam.description: Set to true to include encrypted names when using crypt remotes.

Operations_ListPostShowOrigIDsParam.name: showOrigIDs
Operations_ListPostShowOrigIDsParam.description: Set to true to include original backend identifiers where available.

Operations_ListPostShowHashParam.name: showHash
Operations_ListPostShowHashParam.description: Set to true to include hash digests for each entry.

Operations_ListPostNoMimeTypeParam.name: noMimeType
Operations_ListPostNoMimeTypeParam.description: Set to true to omit MIME type detection.

Operations_ListPostDirsOnlyParam.name: dirsOnly
Operations_ListPostDirsOnlyParam.description: Set to true to return only directory entries.

Operations_ListPostFilesOnlyParam.name: filesOnly
Operations_ListPostFilesOnlyParam.description: Set to true to return only file entries.

Operations_ListPostMetadataParam.name: metadata
Operations_ListPostMetadataParam.description: Set to true to include backend-provided metadata maps.

Operations_ListPostHashTypesParam.name: hashTypes
Operations_ListPostHashTypesParam.description: Specify one or more hash algorithms to include when `showHash` is true (e.g. `md5`).

Operations_StatPostFsParam.name: fs
Operations_StatPostFsParam.description: Remote name or path that contains the item to inspect.

Operations_StatPostRemoteParam.name: remote
Operations_StatPostRemoteParam.description: Path to the file or directory within `fs` to describe.

Operations_StatPostOptParam.name: opt
Operations_StatPostOptParam.description: Optional JSON object of listing flags, matching those accepted by `operations/list`.

Operations_AboutPostFsParam.name: fs
Operations_AboutPostFsParam.description: Remote name or path to query for capacity information.

Operations_PurgePostFsParam.name: fs
Operations_PurgePostFsParam.description: Remote name or path from which to remove all contents.

Operations_PurgePostRemoteParam.name: remote
Operations_PurgePostRemoteParam.description: Path within `fs` whose contents should be purged.

Operations_UploadfilePostFsParam.name: fs
Operations_UploadfilePostFsParam.description: Remote name or path where the uploaded file should be stored.

Operations_UploadfilePostRemoteParam.name: remote
Operations_UploadfilePostRemoteParam.description: Destination path within `fs` for the uploaded file.

Operations_MkdirPostFsParam.name: fs
Operations_MkdirPostFsParam.description: Remote name or path in which to create a directory.

Operations_RmdirPostFsParam.name: fs
Operations_RmdirPostFsParam.description: Remote name or path containing the directory to remove.

Operations_CheckPostSrcFsParam.name: srcFs
Operations_CheckPostSrcFsParam.description: Source remote name or path to verify, e.g. `drive:`.

Operations_CheckPostDstFsParam.name: dstFs
Operations_CheckPostDstFsParam.description: Destination remote name or path that should match the source.

Operations_CheckPostDownloadParam.name: download
Operations_CheckPostDownloadParam.description: Set to true to read file contents during comparison instead of relying on hashes.

Operations_CheckPostCheckFileHashParam.name: checkFileHash
Operations_CheckPostCheckFileHashParam.description: Hash name to expect in the supplied SUM file, such as `md5`.

Operations_CheckPostCheckFileFsParam.name: checkFileFs
Operations_CheckPostCheckFileFsParam.description: Remote containing the checksum SUM file when using `checkFileHash`.

Operations_CheckPostCheckFileRemoteParam.name: checkFileRemote
Operations_CheckPostCheckFileRemoteParam.description: Path within `checkFileFs` to the checksum SUM file.

Operations_CheckPostOneWayParam.name: oneWay
Operations_CheckPostOneWayParam.description: Set to true to only ensure that source files exist on the destination.

Operations_CheckPostCombinedParam.name: combined
Operations_CheckPostCombinedParam.description: Set to true to include a combined summary report in the response.

Operations_CheckPostMissingOnSrcParam.name: missingOnSrc
Operations_CheckPostMissingOnSrcParam.description: Set to true to report files missing from the source.

Operations_CheckPostMissingOnDstParam.name: missingOnDst
Operations_CheckPostMissingOnDstParam.description: Set to true to report files missing from the destination.

Operations_CheckPostMatchParam.name: match
Operations_CheckPostMatchParam.description: Set to true to include matching files in the report.

Operations_CheckPostDifferParam.name: differ
Operations_CheckPostDifferParam.description: Set to true to include differing files in the report.

Operations_CheckPostErrorParam.name: error
Operations_CheckPostErrorParam.description: Set to true to include entries that encountered errors.

Sync_SyncPostSrcFsParam.name: srcFs
Sync_SyncPostSrcFsParam.description: Source remote path to sync from, e.g. `drive:src`.

Sync_SyncPostDstFsParam.name: dstFs
Sync_SyncPostDstFsParam.description: Destination remote path to sync to, e.g. `drive:dst`.

Sync_SyncPostCreateEmptySrcDirsParam.name: createEmptySrcDirs
Sync_SyncPostCreateEmptySrcDirsParam.description: Set to true to create empty source directories on the destination.

Sync_CopyPostSrcFsParam.name: srcFs
Sync_CopyPostSrcFsParam.description: Source remote path to copy from.

Sync_CopyPostDstFsParam.name: dstFs
Sync_CopyPostDstFsParam.description: Destination remote path to copy to.

Sync_CopyPostCreateEmptySrcDirsParam.name: createEmptySrcDirs
Sync_CopyPostCreateEmptySrcDirsParam.description: Set to true to replicate empty source directories on the destination.

Sync_MovePostSrcFsParam.name: srcFs
Sync_MovePostSrcFsParam.description: Source remote path whose contents will be moved.

Sync_MovePostDstFsParam.name: dstFs
Sync_MovePostDstFsParam.description: Destination remote path that will receive moved files.

Sync_MovePostCreateEmptySrcDirsParam.name: createEmptySrcDirs
Sync_MovePostCreateEmptySrcDirsParam.description: Set to true to create empty source directories on the destination.

Sync_MovePostDeleteEmptySrcDirsParam.name: deleteEmptySrcDirs
Sync_MovePostDeleteEmptySrcDirsParam.description: Set to true to delete empty directories from the source after the move completes.

Sync_BisyncPostDryRunParam.name: dryRun
Sync_BisyncPostDryRunParam.description: Set to true to simulate the bisync run without making changes.

Sync_BisyncPostResyncParam.name: resync
Sync_BisyncPostResyncParam.description: Set to true to perform a one-time resync, rebuilding bisync history.

Sync_BisyncPostCheckAccessParam.name: checkAccess
Sync_BisyncPostCheckAccessParam.description: Set to true to abort if `RCLONE_TEST` files are missing on either side.

Sync_BisyncPostCheckFilenameParam.name: checkFilename
Sync_BisyncPostCheckFilenameParam.description: Override the access-check sentinel filename; defaults to `RCLONE_TEST`.

Sync_BisyncPostMaxDeleteParam.name: maxDelete
Sync_BisyncPostMaxDeleteParam.description: Abort the run if deletions exceed this percentage (default 50).

Sync_BisyncPostForceParam.name: force
Sync_BisyncPostForceParam.description: Set to true to bypass the `maxDelete` safety check.

Sync_BisyncPostCheckSyncParam.name: checkSync
Sync_BisyncPostCheckSyncParam.description: Controls final listing comparison; leave true for normal verification or set false to skip.

Sync_BisyncPostCreateEmptySrcDirsParam.name: createEmptySrcDirs
Sync_BisyncPostCreateEmptySrcDirsParam.description: Set to true to mirror empty directories between the two paths.

Sync_BisyncPostRemoveEmptyDirsParam.name: removeEmptyDirs
Sync_BisyncPostRemoveEmptyDirsParam.description: Set to true to remove empty directories during cleanup.

Sync_BisyncPostFiltersFileParam.name: filtersFile
Sync_BisyncPostFiltersFileParam.description: Path to an rclone filters file applied to both paths.

Sync_BisyncPostIgnoreListingChecksumPara.name: ignoreListingChecksum
Sync_BisyncPostIgnoreListingChecksumPara.description: Set to true to ignore checksum differences when comparing listings.

Sync_BisyncPostResilientParam.name: resilient
Sync_BisyncPostResilientParam.description: Set to true to allow retrying after certain recoverable errors.

Sync_BisyncPostWorkdirParam.name: workdir
Sync_BisyncPostWorkdirParam.description: Directory path used to store bisync working files.

Sync_BisyncPostBackupdir1Param.name: backupdir1
Sync_BisyncPostBackupdir1Param.description: Backup directory on the first remote for changed files.

Sync_BisyncPostBackupdir2Param.name: backupdir2
Sync_BisyncPostBackupdir2Param.description: Backup directory on the second remote for changed files.

Sync_BisyncPostNoCleanupParam.name: noCleanup
Sync_BisyncPostNoCleanupParam.description: Set to true to keep bisync working files after completion.

Options_GetPostBlocksParam.name: blocks
Options_GetPostBlocksParam.description: Optional comma-separated list of option block names to return.

Options_InfoPostBlocksParam.name: blocks
Options_InfoPostBlocksParam.description: Optional comma-separated list of option block names to describe.

Serve_StartPostFsParam.name: fs
Serve_StartPostFsParam.description: Remote path that will be served.

Serve_StartPostAddrParam.name: addr
Serve_StartPostAddrParam.description: Address and port to bind the server to, such as `:5572` or `localhost:8080`.

Serve_StopPostIdParam.name: id
Serve_StopPostIdParam.description: Identifier of the running serve instance returned by `serve/start`.

Vfs_ForgetPostFsParam.name: fs
Vfs_ForgetPostFsParam.description: Optional VFS identifier to target; required when more than one VFS is active.

Vfs_ListPostFsParam.name: fs
Vfs_ListPostFsParam.description: Optional VFS identifier; omit to list all active VFS instances.

Vfs_PollIntervalPostFsParam.name: fs
Vfs_PollIntervalPostFsParam.description: Optional VFS identifier whose poll interval should be queried or modified.

Vfs_PollIntervalPostIntervalParam.name: interval
Vfs_PollIntervalPostIntervalParam.description: Duration string (e.g. `5m`) to set as the new poll interval.

Vfs_PollIntervalPostTimeoutParam.name: timeout
Vfs_PollIntervalPostTimeoutParam.description: Duration to wait for the poll interval change to take effect; `0` waits indefinitely.

Vfs_QueuePostFsParam.name: fs
Vfs_QueuePostFsParam.description: Optional VFS identifier whose upload queue should be inspected.

Vfs_QueueSetExpiryPostFsParam.name: fs
Vfs_QueueSetExpiryPostFsParam.description: Optional VFS identifier for the queued item.

Vfs_QueueSetExpiryPostIdParam.name: id
Vfs_QueueSetExpiryPostIdParam.description: Queue item ID as returned by `vfs/queue`.

Vfs_QueueSetExpiryPostExpiryParam.name: expiry
Vfs_QueueSetExpiryPostExpiryParam.description: New eligibility time in seconds (may be negative for immediate upload).

Vfs_QueueSetExpiryPostRelativeParam.name: relative
Vfs_QueueSetExpiryPostRelativeParam.description: Set to true to treat `expiry` as relative to the current value.

Vfs_RefreshPostFsParam.name: fs
Vfs_RefreshPostFsParam.description: Optional VFS identifier whose directory cache should be refreshed.

Vfs_RefreshPostRecursiveParam.name: recursive
Vfs_RefreshPostRecursiveParam.description: Set to true to refresh entire directory trees.

Vfs_StatsPostFsParam.name: fs
Vfs_StatsPostFsParam.description: Optional VFS identifier whose statistics should be returned.

Pluginsctl_AddPluginPostUrlParam.name: url
Pluginsctl_AddPluginPostUrlParam.description: Repository URL of the plugin to install.

Pluginsctl_GetPluginsForTypePostTypePara.name: type
Pluginsctl_GetPluginsForTypePostTypePara.description: MIME type to match when listing plugins.

Pluginsctl_RemovePluginPostNameParam.name: name
Pluginsctl_RemovePluginPostNameParam.description: Name of the plugin to uninstall.

Pluginsctl_RemoveTestPluginPostNameParam.name: name
Pluginsctl_RemoveTestPluginPostNameParam.description: Name of the test plugin to uninstall.

JobBatchResponse.description: Results of the batch job execution.

EmptyResponse.description: Request succeeded with no response body.

EmptyObjectResponse.description: Request succeeded returning an empty JSON object.

SyncJobResponse.description: Response for sync operations, containing job ID if async.

RcNoopResponse.description: Echoes any supplied parameters, useful for testing RC connectivity.

OperationsFsinfoResponse.description: Capabilities, supported hashes, and metadata for the specified remote.

OperationsHashsumResponse.description: Hash algorithm used and the ordered hash lines emitted by `operations/hashsum`.

OperationsHashsumfileResponse.description: Hash algorithm used and the hash value for a single file from `operations/hashsumfile`.

hashType.description: The hash algorithm that was used.

hash.description: The hash value of the file.

OperationsSizeResponse.description: Aggregate object counts and total size from `operations/size`.

CoreBwlimitResponse.description: Effective bandwidth limits in bytes per second and human readable form.

CoreCommandResponse.description: Outcome of a command executed with `core/command`, including streamed result.

CoreDuResponse.description: Disk usage summary for the requested directory.

CoreTransferredResponse.description: Completed transfer records including size, status, and timestamps.

group.description: Stats group identifier this transfer belonged to.

srcFs.description: Source remote or filesystem used for the transfer.

dstFs.description: Destination remote or filesystem used for the transfer.

started_at.description: ISO8601 timestamp when the transfer started.

completed_at.description: ISO8601 timestamp when the transfer completed.

DebugSetGcPercentResponse.description: Previous garbage collection target percentage returned after update.

DebugSetSoftMemoryLimitResponse.description: Previous soft memory limit before the change.

FscacheEntriesResponse.description: Number of entries currently cached by the file system cache.

MountListmountsResponse.description: Active mount points with source remote and mount time.

MountTypesResponse.description: List of mount backends available on this platform.

RcListResponse.description: Metadata for every available RC command, including auth requirements.

BackendCommandResponse.description: Backend command output and any additional returned fields.

ConfigDumpResponse.description: Entire rclone configuration grouped by remote.

ConfigGetResponse.description: Configuration key/value pairs for the requested remote.

ConfigPathsResponse.description: Paths to the config file, cache directory, and temporary directory.

ConfigProvidersResponse.description: Available backend providers and their metadata.

CoreVersionResponse.description: rclone version, build information, and runtime details.

os.description: Operating system rclone is running on (e.g. linux, darwin).

isGit.description: True when built directly from a git checkout.

isBeta.description: Indicates whether this build is a beta version.

goVersion.description: Go toolchain version used to build rclone.

osArch.description: CPU architecture in use (e.g. arm64 (ARMv8 compatible)).

linking.description: Linking mode for the binary (static or dynamic).

goTags.description: Space separated Go build tags, if any.

CoreStatsResponse.description: Current transfer statistics including totals, rates, and recent activity.

transferring.description: Active transfers currently in progress grouped by stats group.

JobListResponse.description: Identifiers of active and recently completed async jobs.

jobids.description: Job IDs suitable for use with `job/status` and `job/stop`.

runningIds.description: Array of integer job ids that are running.

finishedIds.description: Array of integer job ids that are finished.

JobStatusResponse.description: Detailed status for a background job, including timing, success flag, and optional output.

finished.description: True once the job has completed.

error.description: Error message, or empty string on success.

success.description: True if the job completed successfully.

progress.description: Progress measurements supplied by the underlying command.

OperationsAboutResponse.description: Quota and usage information from `operations/about`, including total, used, and free space.

OperationsCheckResponse.description: Comparison summary from `operations/check`, including missing, matching, and differing files.

success.description: True when the check completes without differences or errors.

hashType.description: Hash algorithm used for comparisons when applicable.

combined.description: Combined summary lines when `combined=true` is requested.

missingOnSrc.description: Files present on the destination but missing from the source.

missingOnDst.description: Files present on the source but missing from the destination.

match.description: Files that matched on both sides.

differ.description: Files that differed between source and destination.

error.description: Entries that produced errors during the check.

OperationsListResponse.description: Directory listing entries from `operations/list`, mirroring the `lsjson` format.

list.description: Array of entries equivalent to the items returned by `rclone lsjson`.

Path.description: Path relative to the requested remote root.

IsDir.description: True if the entry represents a directory.

Hashes.description: Hash digests keyed by algorithm when requested.

IsBucket.description: True for bucket/root entries on bucket-based remotes.

Tier.description: Storage class or tier, if supplied by the backend.

Encrypted.description: Encrypted entry name when using crypt remotes.

EncryptedPath.description: Encrypted path when using crypt remotes.

OperationsStatResponse.description: Metadata for a single file or directory from `operations/stat`.

Path.description: Path relative to the remote root.

IsDir.description: True if the entry is a directory.

Hashes.description: Hash digests keyed by algorithm when requested.

IsBucket.description: True for bucket/root entries on bucket-based remotes.

Tier.description: Storage class or tier, if supplied by the backend.

Encrypted.description: Encrypted entry name when using crypt remotes.

EncryptedPath.description: Encrypted path when using crypt remotes.

OptionsBlocksResponse.description: Names of option blocks that can be queried with `options/get` or `options/info`.

OptionsGetResponse.description: Current global option values keyed by block name.

OptionsInfoResponse.description: Metadata describing available options, organised by block.

OptionsLocalResponse.description: Effective option values for the current request, separated into config and filter sections.

ServeListResponse.description: List of active `serve` instances, including their IDs, bind addresses, and parameters.

addr.description: Address and port the server is listening on.

params.description: Serve configuration parameters supplied at startup.

ServeStartResponse.description: Confirmation of a newly started server, including ID and bound address.

addr.description: Address and port the server is listening on.

VfsForgetResponse.description: Paths evicted from the VFS directory cache.

VfsListResponse.description: Identifiers for the VFS instances currently in use.

vfses.description: VFS name that can be used with other VFS endpoints.

VfsPollIntervalResponse.description: Status of the poll-interval setting, possibly including the new interval.

VfsQueueResponse.description: Upload queue entries for the selected VFS.

items.description: Queued item metadata such as name, size, expiry, and upload state.

VfsRefreshResponse.description: Acknowledgement of directories refreshed in the VFS cache.

result.description: Map of refreshed directories to status messages.

VfsStatsResponse.description: Runtime statistics for a VFS, including disk cache and metadata cache state.

inUse.description: Number of active references to the VFS.

diskCache.description: Disk cache metrics when caching is enabled.

opt.description: Effective options applied to the VFS.

PluginsctlGetPluginsForTypeResponse.description: Loaded plugin metadata for the requested MIME type.

loadedPlugins.description: Installed plugins keyed by repository name.

loadedTestPlugins.description: Installed test plugins keyed by repository name.

PluginsctlListPluginsResponse.description: Lists installed production and test plugins with their metadata.

testPlugins.description: Metadata entries for installed test plugins.

PluginsctlListTestPluginsResponse.description: Metadata for installed test plugins keyed by repository name.

loadedTestPlugins.description: Installed test plugin metadata keyed by repository.

concurrency.description: Do this many commands concurrently. Defaults to --transfers if not set.

inputs.description: List of inputs to the commands with an extra _path parameter.

_async.description: Run the command asynchronously. Returns a job id immediately.

input.description: Original request parameters echoed for debugging.

CoreStatsTransfer.description: Progress metrics for an in-flight transfer.

bytes.description: Bytes transferred so far for this object.

group.description: Stats group name associated with this transfer.

name.description: Remote path of the object being transferred.

size.description: Total size in bytes of the object.

speed.description: Current transfer speed in bytes per second.

speedAvg.description: Current speed in bytes per second as an exponentially weighted moving average.

CoreStatsChecking.description: Metadata for an item currently undergoing verification.

group.description: Stats group name associated with this verification.

name.description: Remote path of the object being verified.

size.description: Total size in bytes of the object.
